newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: RUGBY UNION-CROTTY WINS FIRST CAP FOR IRELAND.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-CROTTY WINS FIRST CAP FOR IRELAND.

text.p: Ireland have made eight changes in their team to meet Australia on Saturday following the 40-25 loss to Western Samoa last Tuesday.
The only new cap is Garryown full-back Dominic Crotty who will play on the left wing. Crotty represented Munster on the wing against Wasps and Toulouse in the European Cup.
Jim Staples is recalled at full-back in place of Simon Mason and Paul Burke returns to fly-half instead of David Humphreys.
In the pack Keith Woods ousts Allen Clarke at hooker and Anthony Foley comes in for Paddy Johns at number eight.

Ireland - Jim Staples; James Topping, Jonathan Bell, Mark McCall, Dominic Crotty; Paul Burke, Niall Hogan (captain); Anthony Foley, Denis McBride, David Corkery, Gabriel Fulcher, Jeremy Davidson, Nick Popplewell, Keith Wood, Paul Wallace.
